snippet: The alliance between Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and Bashar al-Assad of Syria reflects the urgent need to salvage the crumbling government in Syria, but also each man’s eroded international standing.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Washington, and Anne Barnard from Istanbul. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow, Steven Erlanger from London, and Alison Smale from Berlin.
byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's trip to Moscow to visit Pres Vladimir Putin and assess fight against insurgents in Syria reveals still chilly relationship between men, even as they have assumed alliance based on mutual interest; Putin has been dismissive of Assad in past, and his primary goal remains preserving Syrian government, if not Assad specifically; alliance also serves to reassert Russia's status on world stage.
lead_paragraph: The alliance between Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and Bashar al-Assad of Syria reflects the urgent need to salvage the crumbling government in Syria, but also each man’s eroded international standing.

headline.print_headline: Assad Finds Chilly Embrace in Moscow Trip
headline.main: Bashar al-Assad Finds Chilly Embrace in Moscow Trip
